page.title: 16Goat-keeping 2:The Deverills
page.content: The{Deverill Pedigree Herd}consists of 4O British/Swiss cross Toggenburg goats. The kids are hand-reared being bottle fed from birth. The female kids are kept as herd replacements and the male kids are sold for meat at 14-16 weeks, the meat tasting rather like lamb. The nanny goats generally produce twins, one recent male kid was to be kept for breeding because of his beautiful markings. The two present billy goats are pure Toggenburg and are used to serve the herd and other goats in the area. They are kept in a separate goathouse and run, away from the milking goats. The herd is treated homeopathically and no antibiotics are needed.They are free range goats.These are beautiful pedigree goats bred purely for milk and meat, they are not shown.
